title: Billionaire Charlie Ergen merging Dish and EchoStar to expand mobile and satellite telecom empire
summary: Billionaire Charlie Ergen is consolidating his telecom empire, merging his companies DISH Network and EchoStar in an all-stock deal.

title: Rocket Factory Augsburg gets €30 million investment boost
summary: Rocket Factory Augsburg has secured fresh investment as it pushes towards a first orbit launch attempt from SaxaVord, Scotland.

title: Solestial to supply solar arrays for Atomos space tugs
summary: Solestial announced plans earlier this month to supply solar arrays for space tugs developed by Denver startup Atomos Space.

title: Boeing Starliner Crewed Flight Test Delayed To 2024
summary: Boeing and NASA have announced another delay for the first crewed flight of Boeing's CST-100 Starliner; they are now targeting no earlier than March 2024.

title: NanoAvionics Prepares LEO Black Hole Research Satellite For Launch
summary: NanoAvionics has unveiled plans to ship a revolutionary nanosatellite for a groundbreaking mission that will investigate black holes and neutron stars from a low Earth orbit (LEO).

title: Pale Blue to supply thrusters for Yonsei University cubesats
summary: Japanese startup Pale Blue announced a contract Aug. 7 to supply water vapor thrusters for South Korea’s Yonsei University.

title: First Starliner crewed flight delayed to 2024
summary: Boeing has delayed the first flight of its CST-100 Starliner commercial crew vehicle with astronauts on board to no earlier than March 2024 as the company continues to work on issues with the spacecraft’s parachutes and wiring.

title: Eutelsat and Thaicom go halves on Asia-focused telecoms satellite
summary: Eutelsat said Aug. 7 it is partnering with a regional satellite operator in Thailand to order a high throughput geostationary telecoms spacecraft over Asia.

title: NASA TROPICS Constellation Fully Operational & Ready For Hurricane Season
summary: NASA's TROPICS (Time-Resolved Observations of Precipitation structure and storm Intensity with a Constellation of Smallsats) are now fully operational, and are ready to bolster monitoring efforts for the ongoing Atlantic hurricane season.

title: HyImpulse Issued First Large Rocket Air Navigation Order from CAA
summary: HyImpulse Technologies has received the first Air Navigation Order from the UK Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) authorizing them to launch one rocket.
